title: Case Study: Chronic TMJ Jaw and Ear Pain in a Young Professional
clinical_history: Jessica M., a 29-year-old marketing executive, presents with a 5-month history of right-sided jaw pain accompanied by intermittent ear discomfort and fullness. The pain began insidiously, initially noted as mild aching in the TMJ region with increased computer work and periods of high stress at her job. She reports pain worsening with prolonged speaking, chewing tough foods, and during periods of emotional stress. Occasionally, she experiences a clicking sensation in her jaw without any episodes of locking or dislocation. Jessica also describes intermittent tinnitus in the right ear and difficulty sleeping on her right side due to discomfort. There is no history of recent dental procedures or facial trauma.

nprs.affected_area: Right TMJ / Masseter and Temporalis Muscles (primary complaint)

aggrevating_factors: Chewing tough or crunchy foods (e.g., steak, bagels), prolonged speaking (meetings >30 minutes), yawning widely, clenching jaw during stressful periods, sleeping on right side.
picture: Patient points to pain immediately anterior to the tragus of the right ear, radiating along the jawline with secondary referral into the ear canal.
easing_factors: Resting jaw (minimal talking), applying warm compress to the area, avoiding hard foods, gentle jaw stretching exercises, NSAIDs as needed.
past_history: Reported habitual nail biting and frequent gum chewing since adolescence. Mild bruxism reported by dental provider two years ago.
medical_history: Otherwise healthy. No history of systemic arthropathy. No neurological disorders.
medications: Occasional use of ibuprofen 400mg as needed for pain (no more than 3x/week).
personal_history: High-stress job with frequent deadlines and presentations. Reports moderate anxiety, especially during work projects. Lives alone, recently increased work-from-home hours. No tobacco; social alcohol use.
imaging: Panoramic radiograph unremarkable. No evidence of joint erosion or bony changes. MRI not yet ordered.
